Gordon & all,

Is there a 'Dictionary of Japanese Tsuba/Tosogu Terms' avail=
able 
somewhere? Do these dictionary's show the Kanji for the word being 
l=
ooked up? AFU's and Richard's glossary's are excellant for showing the 
Kan=
ji.

I am looking for the kanji for mussomokko-gata. I believe this is 8-
s=
ided shaped tsuba. I don't know for sure.

Just asking.

Elliott

Hi John,

> As I said, I do not use hamaguri-ba, so I looked it up in the=
 
Japanese Sword Terms 
> Dictionary by Mr. Kajihara, and, as he states, "W=
hen there is ample 
hira-niku, 
> because this shape looks like a clam shel=
l, this term is used." In 
other words, if 
> there is ample niku between t=
he shinogi and the cutting edge then 
hamaguri-ba is 
> used and used to me=
an the same thing as ample hira-niku or ample niku-
oki. This 
> is not my =
definition because I never used this term nor heard it used 
in Japan.
